paragraphs.name: a8bd
paragraphs.text: Grieving

paragraphs.name: 8f2e
paragraphs.text: This is something I didn’t realize I was doing. My partner died recently. And all my passwords like you, in these systems that ask you for it all the time, were “iloveAnnie-2much”, “AnniebabyI-H3artu”, “Annie-p@ss-luvu2much” etc….

paragraphs.name: d50e
paragraphs.text: My question I had was;

paragraphs.text: Would staff be more productive, have less sick days and be more engaged if the password to your computer was a…

paragraphs.name: 2ae3
paragraphs.text: Great idea! I would caution against using whole words in your password, though, for security reasons. It is much safer to use abbreviations, acronyms/initialisms, and character/number substitutions for letters (as was done in the article).

content.subtitle: What an awesome idea! I used a version of this in grad school. My password was ‘outin4’. For everything. For 5 years. (No, I didn’t get out…

paragraphs.name: 9ee6
paragraphs.text: Mauricio,

paragraphs.name: 8c2d
paragraphs.text: What an awesome idea! I used a version of this in grad school. My password was ‘outin4’. For everything. For 5 years. (No, I didn’t get out of grad school in 4 years, but it kept me focused.) This was back before we needed long, complicated passwords that we changed frequently. Thanks for this article. It inspired me! :-)

fb4985b38ce8.title: By the way, Mauricio Estrella, it's not that Eat2times@day does not work.

paragraphs.name: e508
paragraphs.text: By the way, Mauricio Estrella, it's not that Eat2times@day does not work. It's that the result of eating 2 times a day is not loosing weight. Try creating a mantra password for: eat small thing healthy, every 3 hours while awake & totally cut meat. Then you'll loose weight.

65cfbcdb88c8.title: It comes as no surprise that this post got so many likes and comments, funny, inspiring and somehow…

paragraphs.text: It comes as no surprise that this post got so many likes and comments, funny, inspiring and somehow touching. Loved the perspective on really focusing on short term goals, and on reflecting upon the small (?) next moves. Thanks for this. Wish the greatest success on coming out with the book!

paragraphs.name: bc06
paragraphs.text:
Really wonderful article. I thank MSN’s silly story for bringing me here.
Thank you for sharing! I’m trying to come up with a cool password now…maybe something about not following down the rabbit hole with “lifetime” stories when I should be working? LOL
Glad it happened this time. :)

a016ad8f7392.title: This is one of those life hacks that isn’t BS.

paragraphs.name: 7c36
paragraphs.text: This is one of those life hacks that isn’t BS. I really like it. I’ve done some similar things with passwords but without the need to change every month it didn’t have the same punch, and I was mostly just using them to remember things, not as a mantra to pursue goals. Clearly the main thing is the mantra idea and passwords just make sure you “say” it often. Thanks for sharing.

ab9d6c490226.title: I have anxiety issues and I was really anxious about a new job I think, and my therapist said, “It…

paragraphs.text: I have anxiety issues and I was really anxious about a new job I think, and my therapist said, “It’s just the next step” - as “It’s not the rest of your life.” Nextstep44! became my password. (44 is my lucky number, and I’m enthusiastic so an exclamation point suits me.)
